Exploring Space with CubeSat Technology

The University of M치laga CubeSat Project is developing a state-of-the-art small satellite to advance research, education, and innovation in space technology.

Learn MoreJoin Our Team

Our Mission

The University of M치laga CubeSat Project aims to design, build, and launch a fully functional CubeSat to advance research, education, and innovation in space technology.

Technological Innovation

Developing cutting-edge CubeSat technology to advance the field of aerospace engineering and satellite communication.

Educational Excellence

Providing hands-on learning opportunities for students in engineering, computer science, and related fields.

Collaborative Research

Fostering collaboration between academic departments, industry partners, and space agencies.

Global Impact

Contributing meaningful data to address environmental monitoring, disaster response, and global communication challenges.
Project Timeline

Current Project Status

Track the progress of our CubeSat project from conception to launch with our detailed timeline.

Project Initiation

Completed

March 2023

Project approved by the University Board and initial funding secured.

Design Phase

Completed

September 2023

CubeSat design finalized and reviewed by aerospace engineering partners.

Component Acquisition

In Progress

January 2024

Procurement of hardware components and testing equipment.

Assembly & Integration

Upcoming

June 2024

Integration of all subsystems and initial testing procedures.

Testing & Verification

Upcoming

October 2024

Environmental testing and verification of all systems.

Launch Preparation

Upcoming

March 2025

Final checks and preparations for launch.

CubeSat Subsystems

Our CubeSat is comprised of six main subsystems, each handling critical functions needed for successful operation in space.

Structure

Subsystem

Mechanical design, material selection, and structural analysis to ensure the CubeSat can withstand launch and space conditions.

Learn More

Power

Subsystem

Power generation, storage, and distribution systems to provide electricity to all subsystems throughout the mission.

Learn More

ADCS

Subsystem

Attitude Determination and Control System for satellite orientation and stability in orbit.

Learn More

CDHS

Subsystem

Command and Data Handling System that processes commands, manages data flow, and controls satellite operations.

Learn More

Payload

Subsystem

Scientific instruments and experimental equipment designed to fulfill the CubeSat's mission objectives.

Learn More

Communications

Subsystem

Telecommunications systems for data transmission between the satellite and ground stations on Earth.

Learn More
